title: What if the landlord cannot pay the relocation fee. seriously, the landlord has no money.
question: city has ordered landlord to comply and change converted (illegal) conversion back to garage. tenant will not move even tho given notice. landlord has filed eviction due to compliance with housing dept. gives tenant 60 days to vacate so compliance can be done. relocation fee is to be paid within 15 days of giving the 60 day notice. it is approx 15k. landlord doesnt have the money. really. unemployed single mother not being able to pay mortage hence renting converted garage. whether or not house will be foreclosed on or what is still up in the air. again, landlord cannot pay the relocation...so what happens to landlord? thank you.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Lien,Bankruptcy and debt,Real estate and bankruptcy,Landlord or tenant,Renting a house or apartment,Landlord responsibilities,Real estate,Constructive eviction
answers: Have you considered filing a bankruptcy? That may not clear all your debts, but most ... You should consult an attorney.

If you cannot negotiate a resolution that gets the tenant out, the City of Los Angeles can advance the relocation assistance to the tenant on your behalf and then put a lien on your property plus a significant additional charge to cover their costs and as an additional penalty.
